data.title: imagebutton focus_mask gets kinda broken?
data.body:
This is a tricky one (testet with NewGUI): lets say you don't use a "quick_menu" and you remove the whole part from your screen.rpy. Actually it's just this part that needs to be commented out.

```
## This code ensures that the quick_menu screen is displayed in-game, whenever
## the player has not explicitly hidden the interface.
#init python:
#    config.overlay_screens.append("quick_menu") 
```

If you now use a "add LiveCrop()" in your screen the focus_mask gets broken

script.rpy

```
screen btn_test():

    add LiveCrop((0, 0, 50, 50), "btn_example.png")

    imagebutton xpos 10 ypos 100 focus_mask "btn_example.png":
        idle Null(169, 169)
        #idle Transform("btn_example.png", alpha=0.5)
        hover "btn_example.png"
        action NullAction()

label start:

    "Test" 

    call screen btn_test

    return
```

btn_example.png
![btn_example](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5165216/27256104-83d01c24-53ac-11e7-8cbd-45e55bccd626.png)
NO config.overlay_screens.append("quick_menu") and WITH "add LiveCrop" = NOT OK!
![screenshot at 2017-06-17 22-32-19](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5165216/27256129-1938f786-53ad-11e7-915a-b69e193c0bd6.png)
NO config.overlay_screens.append("quick_menu") and NO "add LiveCrop" = OK!
![screenshot at 2017-06-17 22-37-03](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5165216/27256160-81e40e74-53ad-11e7-9a04-084532d47db0.png)
config.overlay_screens.append("quick_menu") and "add LiveCrop" = OK!
![screenshot at 2017-06-17 22-33-29](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5165216/27256130-1c87f5c2-53ad-11e7-927f-8d45d3ca66d4.png)

Well.... any idea? ;)

data.title: Better error message for duplicate labels

`NameError: global name '_menu' is not defined`

This error message does not reflect the problem and does not provided information that might help with the fix (like label name).

Please improve error message.

Part of error log:
```

  File "renpy/common/00voice.rpy", line 360, in voice_interact
```

data.title: action Language() NVL problem.
data.body:
After changing the game language through action Language, Renpy displays the previous line for the second time. 
Initially I thought the problem in my game. But then I created an empty project with the default screens to test and check the Tutorial. The bug repeats on other people's computers.

Renpy version is 6.99.12.4.2187.

data.title: Call action
data.body:
PyTom, maybe we may create action Call:
```
label call_label(label, label_args = [], label_kwargs = {}, screen = None, screen_args = [], screen_kwargs = {}):
    $renpy.dynamic("screen", "screen_args", "screen_kwargs")
    $renpy.call(label, *label_args, **label_kwargs)
    $rv = renpy.call_screen(screen, *screen_args, **screen_kwargs) if screen else None
    return rv

init -999 python:
    @renpy.pure
    class Call(Action):
        def __init__(self, label, *args, **kwargs):
            self.label = label
            self.args = args
            self.kwargs = kwargs
        def __call__(self):
            if renpy.current_interact_type() == "screen":
                renpy.call("call_label", self.label, self.args, self.kwargs, _current_screen, _screen_args, _screen_kwargs)
            else:
                renpy.call("call_label", self.label, self.args, self.kwargs)


```
and add:
```
    def call_screen(_screen_name, *args, **kwargs):
        renpy.store._current_screen = _screen_name
        renpy.store._screen_args = args
        renpy.store._screen_kwargs = kwargs
```
in renpy.call_screen

This action good working in interact_type "screen" and "say"

data.title: crashes with Nougat Android OS 7
data.body:
I got this report from an user for some of my games that were using old version of Ren'Py. I updated a good amount of games, but looking in the Google Play console, I had a crash even in the updated version. The error is the following one:

java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: 
  at java.lang.Runtime.load0(Runtime.java:914)
  at java.lang.System.load(System.java:1508)
  at org.renpy.android.PythonActivity.run(PythonActivity.java:258)
  at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:776)

so before updating all my other games I wanted to be sure that isn't something else :)

data.title: Use screen default don`t work
data.body:
On screen what added with use statement don't work action SetScreenVariable, example:
```
screen person_menu(person):
    zorder 50
    modal True
    default right_side = None
    textbutton "{size=100}Back{/size}" pos(100, 840) action Return(False)
    frame:
        pos(150, 250)
        has vbox
        for value in person.menu.values():
            textbutton str(value["caption"]):
                action SetScreenVariable("right_side", value) #change work
    if right_side:
        fixed:
            pos(400, 140)
            $renpy.use_screen(right_side["screen"], *right_side["args"], **right_side["kwargs"])

screen person_talk():
    default items = person.menu["talk"]["items"]
    default prev_menu = None
    textbutton "Назад" action Return()
    textbutton "True" action SetScreenVariable("prev_menu", True) pos (0, 200)#don`t work...
    text str(prev_menu)

```
I think error in SetScreenVariable.__call__

```
        def __call__(self):

            cs = renpy.current_screen()

            if cs is None:
                return

            cs.scope[self.name] = self.value # may be change variable in parent screen
            renpy.restart_interaction()

```

data.title: screen on statement and rollback problems
data.body:
So I ran into a problem, “screen on statements” only start their execution after the screen has loaded, and “action Show(screen) “flickers” in high resolution, which obviously detracts from the gaming experience, and I would prefer to simply use:

show screen cabinet_main
Instead of:
show screen cabinet_main
show screen cabinet_time
 
With screens:
screen cabinet_main:
    on “show” action Show(“cabinet_time”)
    on “hide” action Hide(“cabinet_time”)
        zorder 0
    add "images/locations/cabinet_pic/cabinet_main.png"
    add "candle_anim" pos (566, 547)
screen cabinet_time:
    if _daytime:
        add "images/locations/cabinet_pic/cabinet_day.png" pos (614, 0)
    else:
        add "images/locations/cabinet_pic/cabinet_night.png" pos (614, 0)
    if not _curtain_open:
        add "images/locations/cabinet_pic/curtain_close.png" pos (550, 0)
 
Also, I found a problem with the rollback function, it doesn’t save the result if in  “action” function we use other functions on top of the “Return() action, for example if we use:  [SetVariable(“time”, 4), Hide(“some_screen”), Return()], after rollback the screen won’t show back, and the variable won’t return to the original value. As far as I understand, rollback only saves the value under the “_return” variable.

data.title: "default" statement does not work as described
data.body:
Seems like '[default](https://github.com/renpy/renpy/issues/577)' statement does not work properly.
If I add it to an existing game it works fine immediately after first load but after any save/reload attempt to access it results in NameError.

Steps to reproduce:
1) Create a game with this code:
```renpy
#default x = 1

label start:    
    "Save NOW! Then close game, enable commented lines and load this save"
    jump test
    
label test:
    #if x == 1:
    #    "x is 1"
    "Save NOW AGAIN and then load this save!"
    jump test2
    
label test2:
    #if x == 1:
    #    "x is still 1"
    return 
```
2) Run the game and create a save just after game start.
3) Uncomment all commented lines (this is same as adding 'default' statement in new game version).
4) Load game save and click once (you will see "x is 1")
5) Click again and save game into a new slot
6) Load game from that new slot.

Actual result: NameError exception:
```
I'm sorry, but an uncaught exception occurred.

While running game code:
  File "game/script.rpy", line 26, in script
    if x == 1:
  File "game/script.rpy", line 26, in <module>
    if x == 1:
NameError: name 'x' is not defined

-- Full Traceback ------------------------------------------------------------

Full traceback:
  File "game/script.rpy", line 26, in script
    if x == 1:
  File "D:\X\RenpySDK\renpy-6.99.12.4-sdk\renpy\ast.py", line 1656, in execute
    if renpy.python.py_eval(condition):
  File "D:\X\RenpySDK\renpy-6.99.12.4-sdk\renpy\python.py", line 1749, in py_eval
    return py_eval_bytecode(code, globals, locals)
  File "D:\X\RenpySDK\renpy-6.99.12.4-sdk\renpy\python.py", line 1743, in py_eval_bytecode
    return eval(bytecode, globals, locals)
  File "game/script.rpy", line 26, in <module>
    if x == 1:
NameError: name 'x' is not defined

Windows-7-6.1.7601-SP1
Ren'Py 6.99.12.4.2187
test_default 1.0
```



Expected result: text "x is still 1"

RenPy version: 6.99.12.4.2187

data.title: Documentation: What is SL2?
data.body:
In the online documentation we can currently read there https://www.renpy.org/doc/html/screen_python.html#ui-functions :

> With the advent of SL2, UI Functions are deprecated and not recommended.

Searching for SL2 in the documentation only result in the same page.

 1. Is this an obsolete information?
 2. What is SL2?
 3. Shouldn't it be explained in the documentation? Or if it is an external library, provide a link to it's documentation?

I only see code here that use `renpy.sl2` but I still don't know what it is and if I should use it instead of ui functions.

data.title: translation.rpy attempting to create strings.json in unwritable dir
data.body:
I'm using a distro packaged, globally installed version of Ren'Py. An attempt to create a (new GUI based) project resulted in error:

```
While running game code:
  File "launcher/game/translations.rpy", line 286, in <module>
    renpy.translation.extract.extract_strings_core(language, STRINGS_JSON)
IOError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: u'/usr/share/renpy/tmp/strings.json'

-- Full Traceback ------------------------------------------------------------

Full traceback:
  File "/home/ishitatsuyuki/gui7.rpyc", line 418, in script call
  File "/home/ishitatsuyuki/translations.rpyc", line 280, in script
  File "/usr/share/renpy/renpy/ast.py", line 814, in execute
    renpy.python.py_exec_bytecode(self.code.bytecode, self.hide, store=self.store)
  File "/usr/share/renpy/renpy/python.py", line 1719, in py_exec_bytecode
    exec bytecode in globals, locals
  File "launcher/game/translations.rpy", line 286, in <module>
    renpy.translation.extract.extract_strings_core(language, STRINGS_JSON)
  File "/usr/share/renpy/renpy/translation/extract.py", line 45, in extract_strings_core
    with open(destination, "wb") as f:
IOError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: u'/usr/share/renpy/tmp/strings.json'
```

The code to blame: https://github.com/renpy/renpy/blob/06da5ec181998eda9ec39936e33100c8edaa6545/launcher/game/translations.rpy#L41

Here, error handling is missing. It's attempting to write to the global prefix, which doesn't necessarily is permitted to be written. I'm not sure if this is just the lack of error handling or a global/local mistake.

data.title: Stop screen from scaling in over an android port.
data.body: I'm porting over games made in ren'py engine for windows to android. Some of the games I ported have a resolution of 800:600 or sometimes other too. When ported over to android, any game which isn't a 16:9 ratio visuals, scales to adjust and cuts off parts of the game, rendering it unable to play, or move forward in the game  But when these games are played in windows, the screen seems to adjust and it shows perfectly, not stretching or scaling to the desktop screen, showing black screen for the rest of the part. Is there a way for android too, disable the scaling and all.

data.title: Developer options in android port.
data.body: I'm trying to port over games based on ren'py to android. The port is good enough, but even though I enabled Developers options before the port, and it worked inside windows, I'm unable to get it on android yet. Is there a way to have dev console in the android port too?

data.title: Drag does not respect absolute positions
data.body:
The "dragged" method does not seem to check the absolute x and y coordinates of potential hits, rather using their relative ones.

Below is a sample script.py, utilizing a 100x100px frame.png.
It contains two drag targets at 0,200 and 200,200 and a draggable at 0,0
The dragged method is defined to move the object to 500,500 if it is dragged to a valid target, and otherwise to 500,0.

Expected:
a) Drag the object to one of the two targets to have it snap to 500,500, snap to 500,0 otherwise
b) When accessing or setting the x / y coordinate of any drag object, it should return the absolute value on the screen, not the value relative to its parent. Alternatively, there should be extra attributes called "absolute_x" and "absolute_y"

Actual:
When the object is dragged to anything within 0-100,0-100, it snaps to 500,500 (because both drag targets are at 0,0 within their fixed layout), otherwise it snaps to 500,0 (e.g. when dragged onto one of the legitimate drag targets)

I guess as a workaround nothing should be added to containers but rather everything directly to ui (using absolute layout positions), but that seems incredibly inconvenient.


Demonstration code:
```
init python:
    
    def dragged_method(self, where):
        if not where:
            # Snap to 500,0 if no drag target is found
            self[0].snap(500,0)
        else:
            # Snap to 500,500 if a drag target is found
            self[0].snap(500,500)
        
    def add_drags():
        draggroup = DragGroup()
        
        # Create one drag target at 0, 200
        left_container = Fixed(xpos = 0, ypos = 200, width = 100, height = 100)
        left_drag = Drag(d="frame.png",draggable=False)
        left_container.add(left_drag)
        ui.add(left_container)
        draggroup.add(left_drag)
        
        # Create a second drag target at 200, 200
        right_container = Fixed(xpos = 200, ypos = 200, width = 100, height = 100)
        right_drag = Drag(d="frame.png",draggable=False)
        right_container.add(right_drag)
        ui.add(right_container)
        draggroup.add(right_drag)
        
        #Create a draggable. Can be in no container or in a third container.
        # Using no container for simplicity / demonstration purposes
        draggable = Drag(d="frame.png",droppable=False, dragged=dragged_method)
        draggroup.add(draggable)
        ui.add(draggable)

screen dummy_screen:
    $ add_drags()

label start:
    call screen dummy_screen
```

data.body: We should diagnose the fact that Ren'Py is installed in a read only location, and report that to the user.

data.title: ATL transform bug relating to "on show" and "on hide"
data.body:
To reproduce it you can add the following transform to "The Question" project:

    transform demoTrans:
        xalign 0.5
        on show:
            alpha 0.0
            ease 0.5 alpha 1.0
        on hide:
            alpha 1.0
            ease 0.5 alpha 0.0

and then add the following script segment:

    "---"
    show sylvie normal at demoTrans
    "intro works"
    hide sylvie normal
    "outro works"
    show sylvie normal at demoTrans
    "intro2 works"
    show sylvie smile
    "expression change works"
    hide sylvie normal
    "outro glitches"
    "sprite is now hidden"

The transform works as expected for the first bit, but hiding the sprite seems to bug out if the most recent "show" statement didn't explicitly specify the transform.
Changing "show sylvie smile" to "show sylvie smile at demoTrans" fixes the issue.

When the error occurs, the sprite seems to loop between being shown and being hidden for some number of times. The number of times that this cycle repeats seems to depend on how many times you've reloaded the game (or used rollback)

    g.button("dark")

data.title: Issues in _renpysteam
data.body:
1. I created a INT stat called "API1", could not be get by get_int_stat("API1"), but can be get by get_float_stat("API1"), also could not set by set_float_stat("API1", 1.0). Also, I created a FLOAT stat called "API2", could not be get by get_float_stat("API2"), but can be get by get_int_stat("API2"), and can be set by  set_int_stat("API2", 1). 

2. When using get_account_id(), game will crash.
